Description: Small axe head made of basalt, in a roughly rectangular shape with a flat edge that is well defined and sharp. Tapered towards the butt end. The surface is very well-smoothed and finished except for the butt end which has a roughly pitted surface. Small traces of wear on the cutting edge.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E12.4C, low down
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 173)
